page.title: 15Local History
page.content: Three old parish churches, Playford and Gt Bealings in Domesday Book 1086, Lt Bealings 14th Century. Baptist church in Rushmere built 1859. Playford has an obelisk in memory of Thomas clarkson, died 1846 who was a friend of slaves. Moated Playford Hall, 16th Century, impressive building and fine gardens. One tumulus and three later urnfields in south of area have received scant attention from archaelogists. The Manor of Necchemara (Domesday 1086) was identifield recently as a detached portion of kesgrave parish lands 23/46, 23/47 returned to Playford in 1882. kesgrave Hall, built circa 1812, has been intermittently a private house and a school, (its present function). Farmer's small pumphouse 2/46 lifts water from stream in Kesgrave wood.
